title: Printing using different printers crosses user preference paper sizes
content:
I've been seeing an issue where one of my users has 2 types of printers installed that use different size paper, where printing to the main printer works fine, until they print to the label printer. Once that happens the user.prefs show the label printer paper height and width for the main laserjet printer, until manually edited. Once corrected it seems to work fine, until the label printer is used again.

The issue appeared over the weekend, which I believe is when the new update to FireFox was released.
creator: joshua.yoder84

title: Thunderbird will not open, not even safe mode
content:
My Thunderbird is not responding whatsoever, i have tried so many of the fixes in the forums however none have worked?

  • Deleted Parent.lock
  • Tried to hold Shift whilst opening app (no response)
  • Ran restore which showed issues however still not opening?

I have tried a few more and searched so much that I cannot remember...

I have 5 email profiles on there and I cannot access emails!!!
creator: t_cortes

creator: raldeb

title: Tabs on bottom again
content:
I am sure you are tired of hearing about this topic, but it has reached a new level in my case. While I was away from home for a couple of months, I bought a laptop and installed Firefox, and immediately got the .chrome set up to put the tabs where they belong. No problem. I got home and made the "mistake" of updating Firefox on my desktop PC. Shouldn't be an issue; just e-mail myself the .chrome files from my laptop and drop them in the same location, right?

No.

So what is the deal? Did the previous version use a different location that I need to find and delete first? Do I need to say additional Hail Marys?

Both PCs are running the same Windows version (10), with the same Firefox version (82.whatever), with the same .chrome in the same file location on the respective hard drives. In fact, both hard drives are M.2 SSD. So what did I do wrong (besides allowing the update)?
creator: cionaoith
